1.text: Now concerning the collection for the saints, do as I instructed the Churches of Galatia.

2.text: On the first day of the week, each one of you should put aside and save according to Godâ€™s blessing, so that no collections be made when I come.

3.text: When I arrive, I will send whoever you approve with letters to carry your gracious gift to Jerusalem.

4.text: If it is appropriate for me to go also, they will accompany me.

5.text: But I will come to you when I have passed through Macedonia, since I have to go through Macedonia.

6.text: I may also stay with you, or even spend the winter, so that you may send me on my journey.

7.text: Truly, I do not wish to see you only in passing, but I hope to stay with you for a while, if the Lord permits.

8.text: But I will stay at Ephesus until Pentecost,

9.text: because a great and effective door has opened to me, and there are many adversaries.

10.text: Now if Timothy comes, make sure that he has nothing to fear from you, for he does the work of the Lord as I do.

11.text: Therefore, let no one despise him, but set him on his way in peace, so that he may come to me; for I expect him with the brothers.

12.text: Now concerning Apollos, the brother: I strongly urged him to come to you with the brothers; but it was not his desire to come now. He will come when he has an opportunity.

13.text: Watch! Stand firm in the faith! Be courageous! Be strong!

14.text: Let all that you do be done in love.

15.text: Now I beg you, brethren (you know the house of Stephanas, that it is the first fruits of Achaia, and that they have devoted themselves to serve the saints),

16.text: that you also be in service to people like this, and to everyone who helps in the work and labors.

17.text: I rejoice at the coming of Stephanas, Fortunatus, and Achaicus; for what was lacking on your part, they supplied.

18.text: They refreshed my spirit and yours; show therefore your appreciation to such people.

19.text: The Churches of Asia greet you. Aquila and Priscilla greet you much in the Lord, together with the Church that is in their house.

20.text: All the brethren greet you. Greet one another with a holy kiss!

21.text: This greeting is by me, Paul, with my own hand.

22.text: If anyone does not love the Lord Jesus Christ, let him be accursed. Maranatha!

23.text: May the grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with you.

24.text: My love is with you all in Christ Jesus. Amen.
